body.name: The Bear of Pichesham: A thrilling contemporary/historical Fantasy x Sci-Fi novel
body.description: A journalist uncovers the unlikely legend of a 700-year-old bear, only to discover that it may be real—and has plans of its own.New York journalist Annie Maylor needs a new start. Scouring her family history for a story that will reboot her career, she travels to England searching for the truth behind the strange entries in her great-grandfather's diary - stories about a bear, stories that make no sense.What she finds is the village of Lower Pichesham, welcoming and beguiling, rich in history and concealing a hidden past. Lurking somewhere in that past, the bear is real. She has her own stories to tell, improbable adventures that start in the Dark Ages of Central Europe and wind up at the dawn of the space age. And the bear has her own agenda…As their paths collide, Annie begins to unravel the mysteries shrouding Pichesham. When events take a deadly turn, she discovers that secrets lie within her. Secrets that trigger an astonishing adventure of her own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A reporter goes looking for a story, following strange letters from a deceased relative. On a hunt to redeem her career, she ends up in the quaintly odd town of Pichesham. There she finds mystery among the residents and a strange history begins to unfold. Reading the Bear of Pichesham is a mind bending, dimension hopping journey that travels from the far past to the future - blurs the lines between animals and humans, time and souls. Without spoiling the twists, I would recommend this book to anyone who loves mysteries, non-linear story telling, ancient bears, and questions about our existence.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't realise that this was my sort of book!
reviews.reviewText: It is a complex narrative presented from different viewpoints on occasion, building into a crescendo that still manages to twist and turn a few times. I found it a little difficult to keep track of characters and to get my mind around the worlds created by the author, but also very rewarding to do so! I probably missed a few elements earlier on that would have helped, but his only encourages me to read it again. Great imagination has gone into conjuring this tale with all its strange perspectives. Somewhat to my surprise because I didn't think I liked fantasy/sci fi literature, I enjoyed it immensely, perhaps partly because it is so well constructed. It draws you in and leaves you wanting more 300+ pages later.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this book. Incredible imagination and story telling. I had to keep reading to see what happened next. A bit complex in parts but reading it again would probably make things clearer. Well done Jonah.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I found this book well written and a real page turner. If I had to compare to another author, then it would have to be in the realm of Neil Gaiman, for the imaginative journey this story takes you on. I really enjoyed the read and a little sad when it came to an end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it and looking forward to more from this new author
reviews.reviewText: This is a very interesting book, which managed to surprise me several times in a very good way – where, with hindsight, I think I should have spotted a clue but had missed it! I’m a sci-fi and fantasy fan who enjoys the sort of book on the occult that Neil Gaiman might write, rather than that written by Stephen King, and this book matched that set of requirements admirably. The pace is good, almost a little too fast towards the end when I wanted it to go on longer. I found myself quickly caring about the bear and her story, although the other three characters who get caught up with her early on (trying not to create a spoiler here) were a bit less developed. I think the author did that deliberately, but it may just be the bear was so complex a character, and of course the central one, that there was less time to develop the others. Either way, it didn’t spoil my enjoyment of this gripping tale that races through centuries at quite a clip; I just wondered what those three were thinking as the story unfolded! If you enjoyed Good Omens, you’re probably going to enjoy this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Well written, complex storyline, loved it!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely loved this debut story from Jonah Larchwood. A real page turner I couldn't put down that was full of twists and turns all the way through. I'm left with that sad feeling that's it finished which comes after reading a really good book! Fingers crossed for more from this author.
